image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Last year, the High Court found indefinite immigration detention was not legal. Now, two additional cases related to that decision are set to go before it.

title.children: Immigration challenges linked to indefinite detention ruling to go before High Court

image.altText: A man carrying a kangaroo that has burned and bandaged paws.

props.synopsis: Areas that had multiple fires prior to 2019–20 had greater biodiversity losses when Black Summer fires hit compared to areas that had burnt once or not at all beforehand.

title.children: Prescribed burns are used to reduce bushfire risk. A new study suggests it has the opposite effect

image.altText: A high school aged boy in a grey t-shirt and navy New York Yankees cap smiles.

props.synopsis: It's up to state and territory governments to fund media literacy programs in schools, and a 2023 study of young Australians found only one in four surveyed received a lesson teaching them how to work out if news stories are true in the past year.

title.children: Aaron is in year 11 and recently quit Instagram. He thinks others should do the same

image.altText: a herd of wild horses standing in the national park

props.synopsis: A NSW inquiry into the aerial shooting of wild horses in Kosciuszko National Park has recommended the practice should continue, but the chairwoman who led the inquiry's committee says the final report that has been released is "biased".

title.children: 'I am sorry to the brumbies': Inquiry chair criticises finding aerial shooting at Kosciuszko should continue

image.altText: A church building with a cross shrouded under branches

props.synopsis: The Catholic Church wins a High Court appeal against rulings it was vicariously liable for the actions of a priest who allegedly sexually abused a five-year-old in 1971.

title.children: Catholic Church wins High Court appeal against ruling it was vicariously liable for alleged sexual abuse by a priest

image.altText: High Court of Australia, building, generic

props.synopsis: Two survivors of alleged child sex abuse win their High Court battle to sue those who placed them in care in the 50s and 60s.

title.children: Two survivors of alleged historic child sex abuse win High Court battle to sue for compensation

image.altText: A man wearing a white cap and a black shirt with the words"ACT suicide free by 2033".

props.synopsis: John Veloudos used a combination of community support and psychological tricks to complete his first ultramarathon.

title.children: 'It just took absolutely everything': How to run an ultramarathon

image.altText: A blue sign saying Queanbeyan District Health Service sits at the entrance to the carpark of a hospital

props.synopsis: An email obtained by the ABC confirms Queanbeyan Hospital has stopped providing surgical terminations for fetal anomalies and medical reasons, restricting access to a legal and time-critical form of reproductive health care.

title.children: Queanbeyan Hospital bans surgical abortions, telling local health workers the procedure 'does not currently sit within' its scope

image.altText: Donald Trump and Joe Biden sit in the Oval Office and shake hands.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden welcomes his long-time nemesis, Donald Trump, back to the White House for an undoubtedly uncomfortable Oval Office meeting to discuss the transition of power.

title.children: 'It's a nice world today': Trump meets Biden at White House before appointing more loyalists to key roles

image.altText: Matt Gaetz wears a suit, sunglasses and white 'MAGA' baseball cap in a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: It's a decades-old White House tradition, but the meeting between Biden and Trump was nothing short of remarkable. And there were still surprises to come.

title.children: 'Welcome back': Trump's return to the Oval Office was historic, but there were surprises still to come

image.altText: A bag of iv fluids in a veterinary clinic.

props.synopsis: Doctors say they've been forced to ration care as sourcing the essential medicine continues to prove a challenge.

title.children: IV vitamin drips used to make 'expensive urine' even as GPs battle shortage

image.altText: A man looking on, seen from close up.

props.synopsis: The Sea Shepherd and Greenpeace co-founder has been detained since July, with supporters worried a move to extradite him to Japan would see him live the rest of his life in prison.

title.children: 'Delay, delay, delay': Paul Watson has detention extended for another three weeks in Greenland, dismaying supporters

image.altText: A plume of smoke rising out of a residential district full of apartment blocks in Beirut.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah strongholds in Beirut have endured another day of Israeli bombardment, as Lebanon waited to hear details of a proposed ceasefire from the US.

title.children: Six Israeli soldiers killed in Lebanon as Beirut hit by second day of air strikes

image.altText: A silhouetted crowd standing in the morning mist, holding up large flags.

props.synopsis: Activists are protesting proposed changes to New Zealand's foundational document, the Treaty of Waitangi. But is the bill more bark than bite?

title.children: What a controversial law change in New Zealand could mean for Māori people

image.altText: A woman holds her head in her hands

props.synopsis: More than half of migrant women have been sexually harassed at work with their customers, co-workers and bosses among the biggest perpetrators, a new union survey has found.

title.children: 'Sexual objects who can be exploited': Harassment of migrant women rife in Australian workplaces, report finds

image.altText: A composite picture of a woman in black-and-white and a man in colour, both looking serious.

props.synopsis: Championing higher wages is in Labor's DNA, but wage growth may not be able to overcome inflation anger if a rate cut doesn't arrive soon.

title.children: Labor is cheering on wage rises, but if there's no rate cut, will voters even notice?

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un walking through a rose garden together.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin and Kim Jong Un announced a mutual defence agreement earlier this year, which has paved the way for an estimated 10,000 North Korean troops to join in Russia's fight against Ukraine.

title.children: US vows 'firm response' to North Korean deployment on Ukraine front line

image.altText: Gregory Geason on mobile phone outside court.

props.synopsis: Justice Gregory Geason has also been ordered to undergo psychological or psychiatric treatment, to understand the impact of his offending behaviour.

title.children: Tasmanian judge sentenced to 100 hours of community work for assault, emotional abuse

image.altText: A house with Shawline Publishing's logo out the front, there is also a For Lease sign.

props.synopsis: Authors who had their books published through a company that has gone into liquidation say they are thousands of dollars out of pocket.

title.children: Hundreds of Australian authors out of pocket after Victorian publisher's collapse

image.altText: The side of a police car with the logo and word Police.

props.synopsis: The man and woman, both in their 60s, were found dead 2.5 kilometres from their parked vehicle after going missing in in sweltering conditions.

title.children: Bodies of man and woman who disappeared on prospecting trip found in outback Queensland

image.altText: Whale in waters of Queensland's Moreton Bay Marine Park.

props.synopsis: New research has found that recreational boats may be underestimated as a strike risk to migrating whales in Moreton Bay — a region with an "unusual proportion" of humpback whale calves.

title.children: Collision risk for whales migrating through Queensland waters has been underestimated, research finds

image.altText: A black dog stands close to the camera while wearing a harness with a handle being held by a person in biege shorts.

props.synopsis: Peter Frank and his dog are seeking compensation and "change" after two drivers refused to pick him up at Melbourne Airport in 2023.

title.children: Uber sued after drivers 'point-blank' refuse rides to Melbourne teacher and his assistance dog

image.altText: Adnyamathanha elder Uncle Charles Jackson.

props.synopsis: It has been almost one month since Port Augusta became a Declared Public Precinct, but Uncle Charles Jackson OAM says the move simply shifts the issues "out of sight".

title.children: 'It's directed at First Nations people': Elder shares concerns about Declared Public Precinct in Port Augusta

image.altText: Manuel Del Brocco

props.synopsis: A former youth justice officer recovering from a debilitating workplace injury is warning about the safety risks posed by understaffed and overcrowded Northern Territory prisons.

title.children: Manuel had two fingers cut off in a cell door. He's worried about understaffing in NT prisons

image.altText: Danny Gibson smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The former mayor and current councillor of Tasmania's second-largest city has resigned from his position on the Local Government Association of Tasmania, with allegations of unwanted sexual advances against young men unaddressed.

title.children: Calls for an 'independent investigation' after thousands in ratepayer funds spent on Tasmanian councillors' legal fees

image.altText: Angy pro choice and pro life protesters hold up placcards.

props.synopsis: The leader of the free world could make abortion access less free far away from home.

title.children: How the return of Trump could limit abortion — in Asia

image.altText: A girl in a red jumper and black tracksuit pants sits on a couch indoors at night looking at her mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Social media companies would be required to take preventative action against the worst foreseeable harms of their platforms under new laws the federal government has proposed.

title.children: Online platforms would be legally responsible for keeping Australians safe under new 'duty of care' laws

image.altText: Traditional Indigenous art in Nullarbor Caves.

props.synopsis: The new South Coast Marine Park has a hole in it to facilitate a yet-to-be-approved renewables project in a region some scientists believe warrants inclusion on the UNESCO World Heritage List.

title.children: Scientist concerned huge green energy hub could do 'irreparable damage' to the Nullarbor

image.altText: A woman in green scrubs looking solemn and serious near a front yard of a house.

props.synopsis: Grace Searle said she is one of a handful in her Melbourne emergency department who left NSW over pay and work condition concerns.

title.children: Grace became a nurse to 'help people', but left Sydney for Melbourne due to the 'astounding' differences

image.altText: Socceroos coach Tony Popovic stands with his arms folded at training.

props.synopsis: Australia hosts Saudia Arabia in Melbourne with a chance to move into outright second of their group.

title.children: Socceroos ready for any Saudi approach in pivotal World Cup qualifier

image.altText: Two women in border force uniform, black and gold insignia, stand with weapons on a table in front.

props.synopsis: The ABC was granted rare access to official operations at Gold Coast Airport, where passengers are searched for illegal weapons, drugs and animal products.

title.children: Knuckledusters, whale meat, cash and drugs: Behind the scenes at one of Queensland's busiest airports

image.altText: A scuba diver swims alongside a giant brown undulating standalone coral.

props.synopsis: Scientists say they have discovered the world's largest coral — measuring longer than a blue whale — on an expedition in Solomon Islands.

title.children: Scientists discover 'astonishingly large' coral thought to be biggest in the world

image.altText: An underwater photo of a giant kelp forest.

props.synopsis: A global report into kelp forests has found they are under threat from climate change and conservationists are concerned the vital underwater ecosystems on Australia's coastline are not getting the attention they need.

title.children: Loss of vital underwater forests happening 'out of sight, out of mind', marine experts say

image.altText: Students sit at desks completing their exam on lap tops.

props.synopsis: The VCAA says a production error that allowed students to access sample exam questions before sitting the VCE did not affect the integrity of the exam.

title.children: Victorian curriculum body denies VCE is compromised by sample exam blunder

image.altText: A young man and a young woman superimposed on a cartoon background.

props.synopsis: While "master manipulators" are trawling social media to trick many young people into making bad decisions, Australia's peak consumer agency has some advice for those who have fallen victim.

title.children: The 'hot state' tricks scammers use on teens through social media
